element.name: BUSINESS_PROCESS
element.documentation: Instructs the jBpm cartridge to process the contents of this use-case.

element.name: BEFORE_SIGNAL
element.documentation: Will specify that the event on which this stereotype has been modeled is of type before-signal.

element.name: AFTER_SIGNAL
element.documentation: Will specify that the event on which this stereotype has been modeled is of type after-signal.

element.name: NODE_ENTER
element.documentation: Will specify that the event on which this stereotype has been modeled is of type node-enter.

element.name: NODE_LEAVE
element.documentation: Will specify that the event on which this stereotype has been modeled is of type node-leave.

element.name: TASK
element.documentation: Will specify that the event on which this stereotype is to be considered a task. The event on which this stereotype is placed usually is a state node (do not confuse with action state).

element.name: TIMER
element.documentation: The underlying event will represent an action that will be executed on a timely basis. The usage of this stereotype is usually supported by means of a set of tagged values.

element.name: ASSIGNMENT_EXPRESSION
element.documentation: Specifies an assignment expression as a bean-shell script.

element.name: TIMER_REPEAT
element.documentation: After a timer has been executed on the duedate, this tagged value specifies the duration between repeating timer executions until the node is left. If yes or true are specified then the value of duedate is used.

allowedValues.value: a duration as defined by jBpm

element.name: TIMER_DUEDATE
element.documentation: The duration that specifies the time period between the creation of the timer and the execution of the timer. This can be expressed in business hours, minutes, etc...

allowedValues.value: a duration as defined by jBpm

element.name: TIMER_TRANSITION
element.documentation: The transition to take once the timer finishes.

allowedValues.value: the name of one of the transition going out of the state onto which this timer has been modeled

element.name: TASK_BLOCKING
element.documentation: Denotes whether or not this task should be blocking.
